item.title: Hillary Clinton Caught Lying Again on Classified Emails
item.description:
Hillary Clinton Caught Lying Again on Classified Emails

Independent fact checkers have caught Hillary Clinton in another lie about classified emails on her private server. One America's Emily Miller has this report.

item.title: Being Smart about energy production and energy consumption go hand in hand...
item.description:
Being Smart about energy production and energy consumption go hand in hand...

Access the survey results 'State of Industrial Internet Application Development' to learn about latest challenges, trends and opportunities with Industrial IoT, brought to you in partnership with GE Digital. The sun has an efficiency problem. Yes, it produces enough energy every hour to power 2,880 trillion light bulbs.

item.title: See the First Solstice Full Moon in More Than 50 Years
item.description: Look up at the moon on June 20, and you'll be witnessing something that has not been seen for almost 70 years. That night, the full moon will rise on the June solstice for the first time since 1948.

item.title: Challange July 3, 2016
item.description:
Challange July 3, 2016

Tallahassee dealing with water pollution just before holiday.

item.title: Empire Files: Abby Martin Exposes What Hillary Clinton Really Represents
item.description:
Empire Files: Abby Martin Exposes What Hillary Clinton Really Represents

Digging deep into Hillary's connections to Wall Street, Abby Martin reveals how the Clinton's multi-million-dollar political machine operates. This episode chronicles the Clinton's rise to power in the 90s on a right-wing agenda, the Clinton Foundation's revolving door with Gulf state monarchies, corporations and the world's biggest financial institutions, and the establishment of the hyper-aggressive "Hillary Doctrine" while Secretary of State.

item.title: Viewpoints on urban culture...
item.description:
Viewpoints on urban culture...

James Baldwin has been seen as a prophet, as a suspect, as the greatest American essayist in history. He was also a sharp examiner of the urban environment. He captured the rhythms of city life, the character and habits and various circumstances of their inhabitants, as well as he captured the broader character of cultures, populations, and institutions.

item.title: A Hard Walk in Another's Shoes...to both candidates
item.description:
A Hard Walk in Another's Shoes...to both candidates

Only a military mom could write such a fantastic testimony and rebuke to the Muslim pawn used by Hillary's campaign at the Dem Convention to trash Donald Trump. The Facebook letter below is so great and so powerful that it's gone viral.

item.title: And now more important news other than politics…
item.description:
And now more important news other than politics…

NEW ORLEANS (AP) - Amid the craze over virtual characters in the smartphone-based "Pokemon Go" game, a Pokemon that people can touch in the physical world has mysteriously appeared in New Orleans. Someone put up a statue of the iconic Pokemon, Pikachu, at the center of a broken fountain in a park over the weekend.

item.title: Understanding the chicken and the egg...
item.description:
Understanding the chicken and the egg...

I was doing some research to get a rough idea of how many chicken houses there might be across the United States. Local to my area there are quite a number. All very large with a huge amount of roof area for pv solar panels.
